issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: running pig job on oozie hangs due to race condition

comments.body: i've been this on and off on my setup, what is the exact race condition?

@Alejandro, 
 Still debugging.

Pig job through oozie hangs in certain cases due to a race condition. The exact scenario is as follows:
Oozie launches a job which runs a mapper to launch a pig action. In certain cases, it can be seen that the AM (pig launcher) that started the mapper task is stuck waiting on getCounters(). The pig action itself had completed successfully. The mapper task that was stuck seemed to be talking to the JHS to get counters. JHS itself was throwing an AccessControlException. 
{quote}
012-02-21 23:59:59,997 INFO org.apache.hadoop.ipc.Server: IPC Server listener on 10020: readAndProcess threw exception org.apache.hadoop.security.AccessControlException: Can't retrieve username from tokenIdentifier. from client 98.137.97.247. Count of bytes read: 0
 [Socket Reader #5 for port 10020]org.apache.hadoop.security.AccessControlException: Can't retrieve username from tokenIdentifier.
        at org.apache.hadoop.ipc.Server$Connection.getAuthorizedUgi(Server.java:997)
        at org.apache.hadoop.ipc.Server$Connection.saslReadAndProcess(Server.java:1090)
        at org.apache.hadoop.ipc.Server$Connection.readAndProcess(Server.java:1235)
        at org.apache.hadoop.ipc.Server$Listener.doRead(Server.java:570)
        at org.apache.hadoop.ipc.Server$Listener$Reader.doRunLoop(Server.java:369)
        at org.apache.hadoop.ipc.Server$Listener$Reader.run(Server.java:344)
{quote}

It seems that if the mapper task calls getCounter before the pig action AM dies, this oozie job succeeds, otherwise fails..
This is mostly related to DT in History Server. Will update in a bit.
it looks like i'm hitting a similar issue running Hive from Oozie.

Tucu,
 This looks more like a Delegation Token issue. I dont think you should be seeing this in a unit test. Are you sure you see the same stack trace?

I think I cornered this one, but have to be sure.

John, given you already have the setup to test this, can you try running the cluster this patch and let me know?

Will add tests post that, if possible.
Vinod, We need this asap. Can you complete the patch today :). Thks, Amol
Still under testing, John is helping me validate this. We will try and resolve it by tomorrow.

Vinod,
Thanks for the patch.

+1. Just finished testing this and the issue seems to have gone away with this fix. As you suggested, I commented out the sleep in MRAppMaster and that way was able to reproduce this much more consistently.
Thanks for the update John! It's time for the unit tests or atleast the time for investigation of the possibility of writing unit tests..

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12516469/MAPREDUCE-3896-20120228.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1971//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1971//console

This message is automatically generated.

Patch with a test.

I couldn't exactly reproduce the error in the test case, but without the code fix, the test does fail, albeit with a different exception which still indicates the same underlying problem of missing user-name.

The test passes after the code-fix.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

  against trunk revision .

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 4 new or modified tests.

This message is automatically generated.
pls commit asap as this is a blocker for other components of Hadoop stack
+1. Patch looks good.

Committed to trunk, branch-0.23 and branch-0.23.2
Thanks Vinod for the fix, and John for verifying it.
